info.title: Cumulocity Dynamic Mapper
info.description: This API exposes endpoints to manage resources for the Cumulocity Dynamic Mapper.

tags.name: Extension Controller
tags.description: API for managing processor extensions that provide custom data transformation capabilities

tags.name: Device Subscription Controller
tags.description: API for managing Cumulocity IoT notification subscriptions for outbound mappings. Handles device subscriptions for real-time notifications when device data changes.

tags.name: Operation Controller
tags.description: API for executing various administrative and operational tasks on the dynamic mapper service

tags.name: Monitoring Controller
tags.description: API for monitoring connector status, mapping statistics, and system health

tags.name: Deployment Controller
tags.description: API for managing mapping deployments across connectors. Controls which mappings are active on which connectors and provides visibility into the current deployment state.

tags.name: Mapping Controller
tags.description: API for managing dynamic mappings between external systems and Cumulocity IoT

tags.name: HTTP Connector Controller
tags.description: HTTP endpoint for receiving data from external systems via HTTP/HTTPS. Acts as a webhook receiver that processes incoming messages and routes them through the dynamic mapping system.

tags.name: Configuration Controller
tags.description: API for managing Controller, their configurations and service settings.

put.description:
Receives HTTP messages from external systems and processes them through the dynamic mapping system.
This endpoint acts as a webhook receiver that can handle various payload formats (JSON, XML, plain text, binary).
The path after '/httpConnector' is used as the topic for mapping resolution.

**Path Examples:**
- POST /httpConnector/sensors/temperature → topic: 'sensors/temperature'
- PUT /httpConnector/devices/device001/data → topic: 'devices/device001/data'
- POST /httpConnector → topic: '' (empty, root level)

**Security:** Requires ROLE_DYNAMIC_MAPPER_HTTP_CONNECTOR_CREATE role.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Dynamic path that becomes the topic for mapping resolution. Everything after '/httpConnector' is used as the topic.

requestBody.description: Message payload in any format (JSON, XML, plain text, binary)

Binary Data.description: Binary payload (e.g., protobuf, custom binary format)

400.description: Bad request - error processing the message

403.description: Forbidden - insufficient permissions or missing required role ROLE_DYNAMIC_MAPPER_HTTP_CONNECTOR_CREATE

example.error: Authenticated user does not have the required role: ROLE_MAPPING_HTTP_CONNECTOR_CREATE

- POST /httpConnector → topic: '' (empty, root level)

**Security:** Requires ROLE_DYNAMIC_MAPPER_HTTP_CONNECTOR_CREATE role.

example.error: Authenticated user does not have the required role: ROLE_MAPPING_HTTP_CONNECTOR_CREATE

get.description: Retrieves current notification subscriptions, optionally filtered by device ID or subscription name. Shows which devices are currently subscribed for outbound notifications.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Filter subscriptions by specific device ID

parameters.name: subscriptionName
parameters.description: Filter subscriptions by subscription name

put.description:
Updates an existing notification subscription by comparing the new device list with the current subscriptions.

**Update Logic:**
1. Devices in new list but not in current subscriptions → Subscribe
2. Devices in current subscriptions but not in new list → Unsubscribe
3. Devices in both lists → No change

**Prerequisites:**
- Outbound mapping must be enabled in service configuration

**Security:** Requires ROLE_DYNAMIC_MAPPER_ADMIN or ROLE_DYNAMIC_MAPPER_CREATE role.

post.description:
Creates notification subscriptions for specified devices to enable outbound mapping functionality.
When devices are subscribed, the system will receive real-time notifications about changes to the devices
and can trigger outbound mappings accordingly.

**Prerequisites:**
- Outbound mapping must be enabled in service configuration
- User must have CREATE or ADMIN role

**Behavior:**
- Automatically discovers and includes all child devices
- Creates subscriptions for all specified API types
- Returns the subscription with all included devices

**Security:** Requires ROLE_DYNAMIC_MAPPER_ADMIN or ROLE_DYNAMIC_MAPPER_CREATE role.

requestBody.description: Subscription configuration with devices and API types

Device Subscription.description: Subscribe to measurements for specific devices

get.description: Retrieves a mapping by its unique identifier.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the mapping

put.description:
Updates an existing mapping configuration. Note that active mappings cannot be updated - they must be deactivated first. For INBOUND mappings, subscriptions will be updated across all connectors. For OUTBOUND mappings, the outbound cache will be rebuilt.

**Security:** Requires ROLE_DYNAMIC_MAPPER_ADMIN or ROLE_DYNAMIC_MAPPER_CREATE role.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the mapping to update

400.description: Invalid mapping configuration or JSON processing error

delete.description:
Deletes a mapping by its unique identifier. This will also remove all associated subscriptions and cache entries.

**Security:** Requires ROLE_DYNAMIC_MAPPER_ADMIN or ROLE_DYNAMIC_MAPPER_CREATE role.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the mapping to delete

schema.description: The ID of the deleted mapping

406.description: Mapping could not be deleted due to business constraints

get.description:
Retrieves the deployment configuration for a specific mapping, showing which
connectors this mapping is configured to be deployed to.

**Note:** This shows the configured deployment, not necessarily the active runtime state.
Use the effective deployment endpoint to see actual runtime deployment.

parameters.name: mappingIdentifier
parameters.description: Generated identifier for the mapping

Deployment Configuration.description: List of connectors for this mapping

put.description:
Updates the deployment configuration for a specific mapping by specifying which
connectors it should be deployed to. This defines the intended deployment state
rather than the actual runtime state.

**Behavior:**
- Defines which connectors should have this mapping active
- Does not immediately deploy - requires separate activation
- Overwrites existing deployment configuration for this mapping

**Security:** Requires ROLE_DYNAMIC_MAPPER_ADMIN or ROLE_DYNAMIC_MAPPER_CREATE role.

parameters.name: mappingIdentifier
parameters.description: Generated identifier for the mapping

requestBody.description: List of connector identifiers where this mapping should be deployed

get.description: Retrieves the service configuration for tenant of the authenticated user.

put.description: Updates the service configuration of the current tenant.

400.description: Provided service configuration is not valid

get.description: Returns the connector configuration for the given ID.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: The identifier of the connector

put.description: Updates the connector configuration for the given ID. Required role: `ROLE_DYNAMIC_MAPPER_ADMIN`

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: The identifier of the connector

400.description: Invalid request or unsupported connector type

delete.description: Deletes the connector configuration for the given ID. Required role: `ROLE_DYNAMIC_MAPPER_ADMIN`. The connector must be disabled before it can be deleted.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: The identifier of the connector

400.description: Connector is enabled or cannot be deleted

get.description: Returns the code template for the given ID.

put.description: Updates the code template for the given ID.

delete.description: Deletes the code template for the given ID.

406.description: Deletion of internal templates is not allowed

post.description:
Executes various administrative and operational tasks such as reloading mappings, connecting/disconnecting connectors, managing caches, and other maintenance operations. Different operations require different permission levels.

**Please note:** Each operation may have specific requirements and permissions. Ensure that the user has the necessary roles to perform the requested operation.
`ROLE_DYNAMIC_MAPPER_CREATE` Operations:
- `RELOAD_MAPPINGS`: Reloads all mappings for the current tenant.
- `ACTIVATE_MAPPING`: Activates or deactivates a mapping.
- `APPLY_MAPPING_FILTER`: Applies a filter to a mapping.
- `DEBUG_MAPPING`: Enables or disables debug mode for a mapping.
- `SNOOP_MAPPING`: Enables or disables snooping for a mapping.
- `SNOOP_RESET`: Resets snooping for a mapping.
- `REFRESH_STATUS_MAPPING`: Refreshes the status of all mappings.
- `ADD_SAMPLE_MAPPINGS`: Adds sample mappings for inbound or outbound direction.
- `COPY_SNOOPED_SOURCE_TEMPLATE`: Copies the source template from a snooped mapping.


`ROLE_DYNAMIC_MAPPER_ADMIN` Operations:
- `CONNECT`: Connects a specific connector.
- `DISCONNECT`: Disconnects a specific connector.
- `RESET_STATISTICS_MAPPING`: Resets statistics for all mappings.
- `RESET_DEPLOYMENT_MAP`: Resets the deployment map for the current tenant.
- `RELOAD_EXTENSIONS`: Reloads all extensions for the current tenant.
- `REFRESH_NOTIFICATIONS_SUBSCRIPTIONS`: Refreshes notification subscriptions for the current tenant.
- `CLEAR_CACHE`: Clears a specific cache (e.g., inbound ID cache, inventory cache).
- `INIT_CODE_TEMPLATES`: Initializes code templates for the current tenant.

requestBody.description: Service operation to execute with parameters

Reload Mappings.description: Reload all mappings for the current tenant

400.description: Bad request - invalid operation parameters or failed connector operations

schema.description: Map of failed connectors with their identifiers and names

403.description: Forbidden - insufficient permissions for the requested operation

get.description: Retrieves all mappings for the current tenant. Optionally filter by direction (INBOUND/OUTBOUND).

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: Filter mappings by direction

post.description:
Creates a new mapping configuration. The mapping will be created in disabled state by default and needs to be activated separately. For INBOUND mappings, subscriptions will be created across all connectors. For OUTBOUND mappings, the outbound cache will be rebuilt.

**Security:** Requires ROLE_DYNAMIC_MAPPER_ADMIN or ROLE_DYNAMIC_MAPPER_CREATE role.

400.description: Invalid mapping configuration or JSON processing error

409.description: Mapping already exists or conflicts with existing configuration

get.description: Returns a list of all connector configurations. Optionally, filter by name.

post.description: Creates a new connector configuration for the specified type. Required role: `ROLE_DYNAMIC_MAPPER_ADMIN`

400.description: Invalid request or unsupported connector type

get.description: Returns all code templates for the current tenant.

post.description: Creates a new code template for the current tenant.

409.description: Template with this ID already exists

get.description: Retrieves the hierarchical tree structure of inbound mappings organized by topic patterns. This shows how incoming messages are routed to different mappings based on topic matching.

Retrieves the active topic subscriptions for a specific connector with the count of mappings per topic. This helps monitor which topics are being subscribed to and how many mappings are listening to each topic.

parameters.name: connectorIdentifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the connector

schema.description: Map of topic patterns to subscription counts

get.description: Retrieves statistics for all mappings including message counts, error counts, snooping status, and loading errors. Useful for monitoring mapping performance and health.
Retrieves the status of all connectors for the current tenant. Returns a map with connector identifiers as keys and their status information as values. Includes both enabled and disabled connectors.

schema.description: Map of connector identifiers to their status

get.description: Retrieves the current status of a specific connector including connection state, last update time, and any error messages.

parameters.name: connectorIdentifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the connector

get.description: Retrieves all available processor extensions for the current tenant. Extensions provide custom data transformation and processing capabilities that can be used in mappings.

schema.description: Map of extension names to their configurations

get.description: Retrieves detailed information about a specific processor extension including its configuration, status, and available entry points.

parameters.name: extensionName
parameters.description: The unique name of the extension to retrieve

schema.description: Error details indicating the extension was not found

delete.description:
Deletes a processor extension from the system. This will remove the extension and make it unavailable for use in mappings. Only external extensions can be deleted - built-in extensions cannot be removed.

**Security:** Requires ROLE_DYNAMIC_MAPPER_ADMIN role.

parameters.name: extensionName
parameters.description: The unique name of the extension to delete

403.description: Forbidden - insufficient permissions to delete extensions

schema.description: Error details indicating the extension was not found

get.description:
Retrieves the current effective deployment state by querying all active connectors
to see which mappings are actually deployed and running. This shows the real-time
deployment status across all connectors.

**Use Case:**
- Monitor which mappings are currently active on each connector
- Verify deployment consistency across connectors
- Troubleshoot deployment issues

**Response Format:**
- Key: Mapping identifier
- Value: DeploymentMapEntry with connector details

schema.description: Map of mapping identifiers to their deployment entries

get.description:
Retrieves the complete deployment configuration map showing all mappings and
which connectors they are configured to be deployed to.

**Response Format:**
- Key: Mapping identifier
- Value: List of connector identifiers

**Use Cases:**
- Get overview of all deployment configurations
- Export/backup deployment settings
- Audit deployment assignments
- Bulk deployment management

schema.description: Map of mapping identifiers to lists of connector identifiers

get.summary: Get the feature flags for the dynamic mapper service
get.description: Returns features with an indication if some functionality is available or not. This is useful if you want to check for example if outbound Mapping is possible on a tenant or not.
Returns all available connector specifications.

delete.description:
Removes notification subscription for a specific device. The device will no longer trigger outbound mappings when its data changes.

**Security:** Requires ROLE_DYNAMIC_MAPPER_ADMIN or ROLE_DYNAMIC_MAPPER_CREATE role.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: ID of the device to unsubscribe

404.description: Device not found or outbound mapping is disabled

C8YNotificationSubscription.description: Cumulocity IoT notification subscription configuration for outbound mappings

api.description: Cumulocity IoT API type to subscribe to for notifications

subscriptionName.description: Optional name for the subscription to help identify it

devices.description: List of devices to include in the subscription. Child devices will be automatically discovered and included.

Mapping.description: Mapping configuration for transforming data between external systems and Cumulocity IoT

id.description: Unique identifier for the mapping generated by Cumulocity Core

publishTopic.description: Topic where outbound messages will be published

mappingTopic.description: Topic pattern for incoming messages (supports MQTT wildcards)

sourceTemplate.description: JSON template for source data structure

targetTemplate.description: JSON template for target data structure

substitutions.description: Array of field substitutions for data transformation

active.description: Whether the mapping is currently active

debug.description: Whether debug mode is enabled for this mapping

createNonExistingDevice.description: Whether to create devices that don't exist

useExternalId.description: Whether to use external ID for device identification

externalIdType.description: Type of external ID to use

snoopedTemplates.description: List of templates captured during snooping

maxFailureCount.description: Maximum number of failures before disabling mapping

qos.description: Quality of Service level for MQTT

code.description: Base64 encoded code for custom substitutions

ServiceConfiguration.description: Service configuration for the dynamic mapping service controlling logging, caching, extensions, and performance settings

logPayload.description: Enable logging of message payloads for debugging purposes. Caution: May expose sensitive data in logs.

logSubstitution.description: Enable logging of field substitutions during mapping transformation for debugging.

logConnectorErrorInBackend.description: Enable logging of connector errors in the backend system for monitoring and troubleshooting.

sendConnectorLifecycle.description: Enable sending connector lifecycle events (connect/disconnect) to Cumulocity IoT.

sendMappingStatus.description: Enable sending mapping execution status and statistics to Cumulocity IoT.

sendSubscriptionEvents.description: Enable sending subscription events when mappings are activated/deactivated.

sendNotificationLifecycle.description: Enable sending notification lifecycle events for outbound mapping subscriptions.

externalExtensionEnabled.description: Enable support for external processor extensions that provide custom transformation capabilities.

outboundMappingEnabled.description: Enable outbound mapping functionality for sending data from Cumulocity IoT to external systems.

inboundExternalIdCacheSize.description: Size of the cache for inbound external ID lookups. Set to 0 to disable caching.

inboundExternalIdCacheRetention.description: Retention time in hours for inbound external ID cache entries.

inventoryCacheSize.description: Size of the inventory cache for device lookups. Set to 0 to disable caching.

inventoryCacheRetention.description: Retention time in hours for inventory cache entries.

inventoryFragmentsToCache.description: List of inventory fragments to include in cache for better performance. Examples: c8y_IsDevice, c8y_Hardware, c8y_Mobile

maxCPUTimeMS.description: Maximum CPU time in milliseconds allowed for code execution in mappings. Prevents infinite loops and excessive processing.

codeTemplates.description: Map of code templates used for custom processing logic in mappings

identifier.description: A unique identifier to identify the connector

connectorType.description: The type of a connector. Must be one of MQTT, CUMULOCITY_MQTT_SERVICE, KAFKA, HTTP, WEB_HOOK

enabled.description: Flag if the connector is enabled or not

name.description: A meaningful name of the connector

properties.description: The properties of the connector used to establish a connection

ServiceOperation.description: Service operation request containing the operation type and parameters

parameter.description: Parameters for the operation (varies by operation type)

MappingStatus.description: Mapping execution statistics and status information

id.description: Unique identifier for the mapping generated by Cumulocity Core

direction.description: Direction of data flow for this mapping

messagesReceived.description: Total number of messages processed by this mapping

snoopedTemplatesActive.description: Number of currently active snooped templates

snoopedTemplatesTotal.description: Total number of snooped templates collected

loadingError.description: Error message if mapping failed to load

Extension.description: Processor extension configuration providing custom data transformation capabilities

external.description: Whether this is an external extension (true) or built-in extension (false)

extensionEntries.description: Map of available extension entry points and their configurations

Feature.description: Feature flags for the dynamic mapping service

outputMappingEnabled.description: Flag to check if outbound mapping is enabled or not

externalExtensionsEnabled.description: Flag to check if external extensions are enabled or not

userHasMappingCreateRole.description: Flag to check if the logged in user has the CREATE Role

userHasMappingAdminRole.description: Flag to check if the logged in user has the ADMIN Role

description.example: This is the MQTT Connector with the following features...

properties.description: A map of properties the connector needs to establish a connection. The key is the property name and the value is the property specification

supportedDirections.description: A List to define if the connector support INBOUND and OUTBOUND mappings or both.
